basis: The user consistently endorses and commits to practical steps (pre-meal role-play, backup phrases, no-packaging, dessert pacing, long-event scripts) and requests a printable crib sheet, indicating a high likelihood of executing the plan soon.
cognitive_dissonance: Moderate: acknowledges BED challenges in long social events but prioritizes structured plans; remaining tension around social dynamics may surface, yet is outweighed by clear committing language.
negative_thought_patterns: All-or-nothing thinking about portions/desserts; fear of social judgment; guilt or shame around cravings; fear of losing control in 2â€“3 hour events.
emotional_triggers: Social pressure to eat more or keep up with others; cravings during social mingling; heat-related discomfort during outdoor gatherings; fatigue or overstimulation in longer events.
coaching_notes: Continue delivering concise, actionable cues (scripts, role-plays, crib sheets). Reinforce progress with reflection prompts after practice attempts and provide quick, printable materials (one-page crib sheet). Encourage ongoing logging and timely follow-up to adjust strategies for evolving social contexts.
